roleset.name: win, win a prize/contest
roleset.note: WIN-V NOTES: Member of Vncls get-13.5.1. (from win.01-v)
WIN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on win-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls get-13.5.1. (from win.01-n)

roles.note: The noun roleset and unified roleset differ from win-v.01 in that arg4-'in exchange for' has been omitted, and arg1-'thing won' has been split into 2 separate roles, one for the contest and one for the prize. (from win.01-n)

example.name: win a prize
example.text: [The PLO]-1 failed earlier this year *trace*-1 to win membership in the World Health Organization and the World Tourism Organization.
example.arg: membership in the World Health Organization and the World Tourism Organization

example.name: win a contest
example.text: [Wall Street's old guard]-1 seems *trace*-1 to be winning the program-trading battle.

example.name: with beneficiary
example.text: She won grant money for the school, advised cheerleaders, ran the pep club, proposed and taught a new ``Cultural Literacy'' class in Western Civilization and was chosen by the school PTA as ``Teacher of the Year.''

example.name: with prize giver
example.text: Even if there is consumer resistance at first, a wine that [*T*-167] wins high ratings from the critics will eventually move.

example.name: with in-exchange-for role
example.text: He won D.T.'s queen for two minor pieces and two pawns -- not enough compensation, in this position, to give the computer much hope.
example.arg: for two minor pieces and two pawns -- not enough compensation, in this position, to give the computer much hope

example.name: arg0
example.text: And Ralph Nader , who may make the difference between a Gore or Bush win in several places .

example.name: with loser, won-over
example.text: The Mariners can move on to the American League Champion SHN Series with a win over the White Sox this afternoon .

example.name: with arg2
example.text: he and his team are also still optimistic about a win in the recount

example.name: arg0 oblique and adjectival arg2
example.text: It was only the second World Cup win for Hummer who 's been on the national team for five years .
example.arg: for Hummer who's been on the national team for five years

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Sinatra's start into show business was the successful win of first prize in the 1935 radio talent program, Major Bowes Amateur Hour.
example.arg: in the 1935 radio talent program, Major Bowes Amateur Hour

example.name: misparsed phrasal
example.text: Years ago, he collaborated with the new music gurus Peter Serkin and Fred Sherry in the very countercultural chamber group Tashi, which [*T*-13] won audiences over to dreaded contemporary scores like Messiaen's ``Quartet for the End of Time.''
example.arg: which -> the very countercultural chamber group Tashi
to dreaded contemporary scores like Messiaen's ``Quartet for the End of Time
